entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is the one who poured mead into glasses and spoke to Harry. He is described as raising his glass to Harry and enjoying himself.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character who received a glass of mead from Dumbledore. He is described as sipping the mead and enjoying it.

entities.name: madam rosmerta
entities.description: Madam Rosmerta is mentioned as the one who made the oak-matured mead that Dumbledore poured into glasses.

entities.name: the dursleys
entities.description: The Dursleys are Harry's relatives who received a glass of mead but tried to ignore it.

entities.name: sirius
entities.description: Sirius is mentioned as the one who left his belongings to Harry in his will.

relationships.description: Dumbledore raised his glass to Harry, indicating a friendly or celebratory gesture.
Dumbledore poured mead into glasses that Madam Rosmerta made.
